oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A general partial discretization methodology for interlaminar stress computation in composite laminates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KANT, T
PENDHARI, SS
DESAI, YM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mixed finite-element
segmentation method
sandwich plates
numerical-analysis
order theory
model
composite laminates
partial finite element
boundary value problem
initial value problem
numerical integration method
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A two-point boundary value problem (BVP) is formed in the present work governed by a set of first-order coupled ordinary differential equations (ODEs) in terms of displacements and the transverse stresses through the thickness of laminate (in domain -h/2 < z < h/2) by introducing partial discretization methodology only in the plan area of the three dimensional (3D) laminate. The primary dependent variables in the ODEs are those which occur naturally on a plane z=a constant. An effective numerical integration (NI) technique is utilized for tackling the two-point BVP in an efficient manner. Numerical studies on cross-ply and angle-ply composite plates are performed and presented, involving both validation and solution of new problems.
